channel.title: Port Forwarding Your Server
channel.description:
Port Forwarding your server lets it public, if for some reason people can't connect to your server its probably because you haven't Port Forwarded yet, or its your firewall. Well lets start out with firewall.
[b]Firewall[/b] If you have Windows Vista (which I do) hit your start button, then search Windows Firewall, click the second program that comes up. Then press change settings, then go up top and click "Exceptions" press "Add Port" Then put your Private Server name such as "AproximityPvP" then make the port "43594" then press ok.
[b]Port Forwarding[/b] If you have a netgear router (default) then go to "192.168.1.1" in you adress bar, then put your username as "Admin" then password as "password", then scroll down, and hit Port Forward/Triggering. Then open up run, then type in "cmd" then type IPconfig, then when you see your static IP address, put that into what IP your going to portforward, then press done. Then edit it, Put the title as "RsPs" then "UDP/TCP" then "43594" then "43594" then put in your static IP.
Congratulations, your server is now Public!

item.title: Port Forwarding Your Server
item.dc:creator: @skepskep skepskep
item.description:
@skepskep wrote:

You don’t need to allow UDP.

If you have a UDP server, go away.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding Your Server
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

I truly hope you realize that all routers are different, meaning that you can’t use 192.168.1.1 for all routers, nor can you use those login credentials. This isn’t even a tutorial.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding Your Server
item.dc:creator: @AproximityPvP_317_50 AproximityPvP[317][508]
item.description:
@AproximityPvP_317_50 wrote:

Port Forwarding your server lets it public, if for some reason people can’t connect to your server its probably because you haven’t Port Forwarded yet, or its your firewall. Well lets start out with firewall.

Firewall
If you have Windows Vista (which I do) hit your start button, then search Windows Firewall, click the second program that comes up. Then press change settings, then go up top and click “Exceptions” press “Add Port” Then put your Private Server name such as “AproximityPvP” then make the port “43594” then press ok.

Port Forwarding
If you have a netgear router (default) then go to “192.168.1.1” in you adress bar, then put your username as “Admin” then password as “password”, then scroll down, and hit Port Forward/Triggering. Then open up run, then type in “cmd” then type IPconfig, then when you see your static IP address, put that into what IP your going to portforward, then press done. Then edit it, Put the title as “RsPs” then “UDP/TCP” then “43594” then “43594” then put in your static IP.

Congratulations, your server is now Public!

Read full topic
